page.title: 08Principal Features 2
page.content: Abergavenny lies on an important route into Wales from England and the title "Gateway of Wales" is well justified. There is much rich farming land and Abergavenny grew to become the main market town in the area.Athriving sheep and cattle market takes place on Tuesdays and Fridays.Regular horse and pony sales occur on Saturdays.A produce and general market occupies the Town Hall with many more stalls set up on Market Days outside. Every July the Abergavenny and Border Counties Show is held and this has become one of the largest agricultural shows staged in Wales.In September a Ploughing Match,Horse Show,Gymkhana and Sheepdog Trials take place in nearby Pandy.
